sentences: Claudine Clark (born April 26, 1941) is an American R&B musician, best known as the singer and composer of the 1962 hit, "Party Lights", which reached No. 5 on the Billboard Hot 100.
Clark was born in Macon, Georgia, United States, but grew up in Philadelphia, and she began recording in 1958 for the Herald record label, with her debut single, "Angel of Happiness".
Clark then moved to New York, but she also found no commercial return from her recording on Gotham Records, before moving to Chancellor Records.
She continued to record and compose, including under the alias Joy Dawn for the Swan Records label, but saw no further tangible success.
